The '''Little Lune''' was a western tributary of the river [[Lhûn|Lune]]. It flowed from its source on the eastern side of the northern part of the [[Ered Luin]] eastwards until its confluence with the Lune.<ref>{{FR|Map}}</ref><ref>{{UT|Map}}</ref><ref>{{PM|XNotes}}, note 63, p. 328</ref><ref group=note>The Little Lune is unnamed on the [[General Map of Middle-earth]], [[The West of Middle-earth at the End of the Third Age]] map and [[The Third Map of The Lord of the Rings]].</ref>

The Little Lune was the northern border of the [[elven]] realm of [[Lindon]] and north of it was [[Dwarves|Dwarf]]  territory.<ref>{{PM|Atani}}, p. 313</ref> This territory included dwarf-mines close to the northern end of the Ered Luin,<ref>{{PM|XNotes}}, note 64, p. 328</ref> in which [[Arvedui]], the last king of [[Arthedain]] fled after the conquest of [[Fornost Erain]] by the troops of [[Angmar]]<ref>{{App|Eriador}}, entry for king Arvedui, p. 1041</ref> in {{TA|1974}}.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 1974, p. 1086</ref>

==Etymology==
Lune is a [[Westron]] name. It is an alteration of the elvish name ''Lhûn''.<ref>{{App|Translation}}, p. 1134</ref>
